sense.name: a test or prototype project
sense.examples: The network has produced six episodes for the pilot of their new situation comedy. John received funding for his pilot study of butterfly migration routes. Three pilot after-school programs got cancelled.

sense.name: person who flies an aircraft
sense.examples: Bill was a fighter pilot in the navy. The airline pilots are expected to go on strike next week. Who is the pilot in command of this marketing campaign? (figurative)

sense.name: person who guides a large ship into port
sense.examples: This harbor requires that all large vessels use a local pilot to guide them into port. We saw a pilot boat approaching our cruise ship.

sense.name: small auxiliary gas burner
sense.examples: The pilot light went out again on our furnace. He lit the pilot with a match.

sense.name: fender or cowcatcher on front of locomotive
sense.examples: The box was pushed aside and off the track by the locomotive's pilot. That painting of a 19th-century train shows a large, decorative pilot on the front of the locomotive.

sense.name: a device to guide a tool or machine part
sense.examples: A pilot bit creates a small hole which can then guide a larger drill.
